Interface Polynomial

public interface Polynomial

Method Detail

getDegree

int getDegree()
Returns the degree of the polynomial.

Returns:
the largest exponent with a non-zero coefficient. If all terms have zero exponents, it returns 0.

getMinExponent

int getMinExponent()
Returns the smallest exponent that appears in the polynomial.

Returns:
the smallest exponent with a non-zero coefficient. If all terms have zero exponents, it returns 0.

getCoeff

int getCoeff(int d)
Returns the coefficient corresponding to the given exponent. Returns 0 if there is no term with that exponent in the polynomial.

Parameters:
d - the exponent whose coefficent is returned.
Returns:
the coefficient of the term of whose exponent is d.

isZero

boolean isZero()
Returns:
true if the polynomial represents the zero constant

add

Polynomial add(Polynomial q)
Returns a polynomial by adding the parameter to this. Neither this nor the parameter are modified.

Parameters:
q - the polynomial to add to this. q should not be null.
Returns:
this + q
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if q is null

multiply

Polynomial multiply(Polynomial q)
Returns a polynomial by multiplying the parameter with this. Neither this nor the parameter are modified. q should not be null.

Parameters:
q - the polynomial to multiply with this
Returns:
this * q
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if q is null

subtract

Polynomial subtract(Polynomial q)
Returns a polynomial by subtracting the parameter from this. Neither this nor the parameter are modified.

Parameters:
q - the polynomial to subtract from this. q should not be null.
Returns:
this - q
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if q is null

minus

Polynomial minus()
Returns a polynomial by negating this. this is not modified.

Returns:
-this

wellFormed

boolean wellFormed()
Returns true if the object's class invariant holds

Returns:
true iff the class invariant holds
